title: Olivia Culpo, Avril Lavigne and Shanina Shaik don out-of-this-world numbers for UNICEF Ball
text:
The stars were out getting a jump on Halloween for the UNICEF Masquerade Ball at Kimpton La Peer Hotel in West Hollywood on Saturday.

Olivia Culpo, Avril Lavigne and Shanina Shaik were among the high-profile celebs on hand to put their best festive fashion foot forward.

The ball is UNICEF Next Generation's signature philanthropic event that typically draws more than 800 emerging global leaders, innovators, philanthropists and celebrities, according to the organization's website.

Halloween: Olivia Culpo, Avril Lavigne and Shanina Shaik also put their best fashion foot forward when they attended the UNICEF Masquerade Ball in West Hollywood on Saturday

Culpo, 27, showed off her modeling skills in a gold dress that was lined with shiny ruffles that stuck out several inches along most of the futuristic looking number.

The former Miss Universe wore matching heels and looked stunning with her dark brown tresses styled long, straight and pushed to the right side with a flip at the ends.

Lavigne took the futuristic-theme even father in a bright silver mini-dress, with matching knee-high boots.

The Complicated singer, 35, took a notch higher with a light blue long wig that had a part in the middle

Out of this world: Culpo's dressed was lined feathered-ruffles that stuck out several inches along much of the futuristic looking number

Stunner: The former Miss Universe wore matching heels and looked stunning with her dark brown tresses styled long, straight and pushed to the right side with a curl at the ends

Lavigne, 35, took the futuristic-theme even father in a bright silver mini-dress, with matching knee-high boots and a long two-tone blue wig

Shiny: The number showed off her curves with its fitted design and plunging neckline

Shaik, 28, put on quite the display when she hit the red carpet in her white shoulder-less number, with train, that was equal parts dress and leotard.

It helped the the Aussie model flaunt her endless legs at a moments notice

Among the highlights of the night was a special performance by Billie Eilish.

She opted for a more sinister look in a black and metallic ensemble that included a silver-mesh mask, zippered pants and black boots that were adorned with chains and spikes.

UNICEF is present in 191 countries and territories around the world. It was created by United nations General Assembly in 1946, to help provide food and healthcare to children and mothers in countries that had been devastated by World War II.

Skills on display: The Aussie model showed off her world class gams on the red carpet

Lady in black: Eilish opted for a sinister look in a black and metallic ensemble that included a silver-mesh mask, zippered pants and black boots that were adorned with chains and spikes

Rocking the house: Eilish. 17, was one of the highlights on the night when she took the stage for a special performance

Romance: Noah Centineo and Alexis Ren made their red carpet debut at the event

Shining star: Ren dazzled in her gunmetal gown

Retro: Tinashe looked like a blast from the past in her slinky black dress with opera gloves

Halloweentown: Nats Getty and Gigi Gorgeous went as Jack Skellington and Sally from Nightmare Before Christmas while there with Nats' brother August

Guy style: Ross Butler wore all blue while Brandon Lee went with a dapper tux

Chic: Dancing With The Stars duo Maksim Chmerkovskiy and wife Peta Murgatroyd balanced glamour and attitude in their upscale Halloween looks

So in love! The dancer couple shared a sweet kiss on the red carpet

Eye see you! Tallulah Willis dressed in some stylish menswear and an eyeball mask

Regal: Carmella Rose looked like a princess in her plunging champagne gown
description: Olivia Culpo dazzled in leggy golden dress as Avril Lavigne and Shanina Shaik donned out-of-this-world numbers for UNICEF's Masquerade Ball in West Hollywood on Saturday.
